related_questions.question: Are male juveniles more likely to commit delinquent acts than females?
related_questions.snippet: Overview of Current Statistics. According to the Office of Juvenile Justice and Delinquency Prevention (OJJDP), males are more likely to be involved in juvenile crime than females. In 2019, males accounted for approximately 72% of all juvenile arrests in the United States, while females accounted for around 28% 1.
